messages.title: DON'T GIVE THE EU £45 MILLION A DAY

keyPolicies.policyDescription: Will pursue and campaign for an A&E for Wyre Forest and not give up.

72% of our laws are made in the EU not Westminster. Highlighting the desire to give the country back control over laws and reintroduce manufacturing and jobs. Aims for the UK to withdraw from the EU, saving £45 million per day to spend as we please.
Promises more local decision making rather than decisions made in the EU that affect locally, such as Post offices staying closed, HIPS, and light bulbs.
Support for more police on the beat and a zero tolerance to create a safer community.
No means testing pensioners and scrapping inheritance tax.
Reopen A&E, bring back matrons, and care not targets.
Support farmers, protect countryside and no wind turbines.
Promote youth ambition with student grants not loans.

mentions.candidate: I am Michael Wrench your straight talking local Wyre Forest parliamentary candidate for the UK Independence Party (UKIP).

issues.brexitEurope: 72% of our laws are made in the EU not Westminster. What right do the Politicians think they have to give our country away without asking first? Outside the EU, we can restore manufacturing, create jobs and responsibility locally for ourselves and free thinking and independence.
issues.economy: Outside the EU we can restore manufacturing, create jobs and responsibility locally.
issues.education: Promote youth ambition with student grants not loans.
issues.environment: Support farmers, protect countryside and no wind turbines.
issues.health: Will pursue and campaign for an A&E for Wyre Forest and not give up. Reopen A&E, bring back matrons, care not targets.
issues.socialWelfare: No means testing pensioners and scrapping inheritance tax.

leaflet.personalStatement: Born in 1968 I grew up in Kidderminster, worked at Caramespeed before joining the Armed Forces. I served with the Royal Corps of Signals in Europe and the Falklands. I am not a career politician, a Doctor, Investment Banker, Journalist or TV Producer, but I do understand that common sense and straight talking is what’s needed to get us out of the mess, which through no fault of our own, we now find ourselves in.
